page.title: 01Warbleton, East Sussex
page.content: The area studied is completely contained in the parish of Warbleton close to the market town, Heathfield. The Manor of Warbleton is mentioned in the first Domesday survey in the Rape of Hastings. The village of Rushlake Green, about 2 miles from Warbleton village is now the active heart of the area, being the meeting point of five minor roads. Here houses cluster around the triangular green interspersed with two shops a public house, a parish room and the Dunn village hall. Until recently there was also a garage. A post office is part of one of the village stores, which also runs a delivery van, a vital service to some isolated homes. The Norman church of St Mary's with its square stone tower lies up on the hill at Warbleton now a hamlet as are Turners Green and Chapmans Town.
